revised_title: Investigating the Nature of Discharge in Gases at Low Pressures Using Perforated Electrodes
tldr: The author investigates the nature of gas discharge at low pressures using perforated electrodes and a Faraday cylinder. The experiments reveal that about half the current in the tube is brought up to the cathode by positively charged particles with sufficient velocity to pass through the slit. The results also suggest that the current density on the cathode surface is not solely determined by the total current passing through the tube.
